data.author: Staffan Thomen

changelog.release_notes: Release 1.13: Fix a glitch where the text was invisible on basalt (no color yet)
Built with SDK 3.0 for Pebble Time
1.11: Add charging indicators (blinking block & small flash)
1.10: Also display the current confidence value

1.9
Added low battery warning, the last two blocks blink once per second
1.7 Bugfix: the current state would never be written to the persistent storage

1.6
Implements a settings page, and a feature to wipe the current battery stats if you are unhappy with them

1.5
Bugfixes in the estimate code (Again. It feels like I wrote more bugs than code before release)

1.4
Bugfixes: Lots. It should work now, honest.

1.3

Bugfix: increase resolution of stored value, database updates. This will force a recalibration unfortunately. I'm developing this app faster than I can test it (curse you pebble superb battery life)

1.2

Bugfix: The rate would always be stored as 0 due to a cast error

Version 1.1

This version implements a crude estimate for how long your battery will last. Please note that due to the low resolution of the pebble battery meter and the enormous battery life of the Pebble, calibration will take a LONG, LONG, time.

data.description:
A simple battery meter watchface that shows the percentage and boxes representing the current battery level. 

Features:
- Fancy start animation
- Battery lifetime estimate

Please note that calibrating will  take a very long time ("Estimate unavailable"), you will need to wait for the pebble to drain at least 10% battery after install - Calibration is resettable

latest_release.release_notes: Release 1.13: Fix a glitch where the text was invisible on basalt (no color yet)

data.title: Simple Battery Meter
